intro: Siphocampylus sparsipilus, commonly known as the slender beardtongue, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the plant family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant produces showy, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Siphocampylus sparsipilus thrives in dry, open habitats like grasslands and rocky slopes, and it is adapted to full sun exposure. Its fibrous root system helps it survive in nutrient-poor soils, making it a resilient species in its native environment.
